verses.roman:
mukha-vāsa diyā prabhure karāila śayana
āpane bhaṭṭa karena prabhura pāda-samvāhana

synonyms: mukha-vāsa—spices; diyā—offering; prabhure—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; karāila—made to do; śayana—resting; āpane—personally; bhaṭṭa—Śrīla Vallabha Bhaṭṭa; karena—does; prabhura—of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; pāda-samvāhana—massaging the leg.
translation: The Lord was then given spices to purify His mouth. Afterwards He was made to rest, and Vallabha Bhaṭṭācārya personally massaged His legs.
